alert.note: Alert for Carter (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Carter County through 345 PM MDT... At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alzada, or 37 miles northwest of Belle Fourche, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain, winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Watch for water over the roads including Highway 212. Locations impacted include... Alzada and Albion. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
